metadata.title: CVE-2020-12392 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
The 'Copy as cURL' feature of Devtools' network tab did not properly escape the HTTP POST data of a request, which can be controlled by the website. If a user used the 'Copy as cURL' feature and pasted the command into a terminal, it could have resulted in the disclosure of local files. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox < 76, and Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
